question: A square loop of side length 'a' is moving away from an infinitely long current carrying conductor at a constant speed 'v' as shown. Let 'x' be the instantaneous distance between the long conductor and side AB. The mutual inductance (M) of the square loop - long conductor pair changes with time (t) according to which of the following graphs?
images/2024-phy-2-1.png
explanation: The magnetic field due to the long wire varies as <katex>$B \propto \frac{1}{x}$</katex>. Since <katex>$x = vt$</katex>, the flux <katex>$\phi \propto \frac{1}{vt}$</katex> (approximately).
Mutual inductance <katex>$M = \frac{\phi}{I}$</katex>, so M decreases non-linearly with time as the loop moves away.
Graph A represents a rectangular hyperbola type decrease <katex>$M \propto \frac{1}{t}$</katex>.
